title.rendered: Weekly Recap 1- Top 10 Digital Marketing News of February

content.rendered:
We have done the research and compile a list of exclusive digital marketing news that we found across the various portals. Due to lack of time, If you have missed the digital marketing news, here have come up with all the latest digital marketing news and articles that will keep you updated with what happening in the digital industry.

Table of Contents

Toggle
  • Announcing Mobile-first Indexing for the Whole Web
  • Guide to Amazon SEO for Maximum Visibility
  • Google: We’re Not Going To Index All Your Pages
  • How to Find Unnatural Links & What to Do About Them
  • How Much Do Users Trust Their Search Results?
  • Twitter Launches Its Own Take on Stories With ‘Fleets’
  • How to Visualize Data With Google Data Studio
  • Top Marketing Podcasts You Should Follow in 2020
  • Keyword Research for SEO: The Definitive Guide (2020)
  • The State of SaaS Landing Pages in 2020

Announcing Mobile-first Indexing for the Whole Web

From our analysis, most sites shown in search results are good to go for mobile-first indexing, and 70% of those shown in our search results have already shifted over. To simplify, we’ll be switching to mobile-first indexing for all websites starting September 2020. Continue reading →

Guide to Amazon SEO for Maximum Visibility

Amazon is now the primary destination for product search, numerous studies and surveys have shown. And where there’s demand, there’s competition. There are now more brands competing to appear at the top of those Amazon searches than ever. That’s why understanding how Amazon’s A9 search algorithm works is critical to your success on the platform. Continue reading →

Google: We’re Not Going To Index All Your Pages

John Mueller of Google had to tell one SEO that it is not going to happen, Google is not going to index all of the pages on his web site. The site has over 800,000 pages and Google has only indexed 3,000 of those pages. John told this webmaster on Twitter “They’ll possibly never be indexed.” Continue reading →

How to Find Unnatural Links & What to Do About Them

My ultimate link building wishlist is for my websites to be tucked away on page one of Google stuffed full of backlinks coming from websites with a domain authority of 60+. The reality is the majority of websites have backlinks coming from low-quality, irrelevant websites. Continue reading →

How Much Do Users Trust Their Search Results?

As a result of Google’s dedication to combating misinformation and fake news, we could reasonably expect searchers to agree that Google has improved in its ability to surface credible and trusted content. But does the average searcher actually feel that way? Continue reading →

Twitter Launches Its Own Take on Stories With ‘Fleets’

Users with the Fleets available will see a new, rounded profile icon at the top of their Twitter feed, as you can see in the first image above. If your connections have posted Fleets, they’ll appear in their own round bubbles, which is obviously very similar to the common Stories format on Instagram, Facebook, Snapchat, etc. Continue reading →

How to Visualize Data With Google Data Studio

You’re familiar with Google Docs and Sheets, but have you used Google Data Studio? The free tool lets you turn data into eye-catching visuals and easy-to-read reports. Learn how to use it and your audiences will thank you. Continue reading →

Top Marketing Podcasts You Should Follow in 2020

Are you searching for the top marketing podcasts to get ideas on how to improve your marketing and grow your business? Podcasts have become popular entertainment for many, and they are one of the best ways to consume valuable information from experts. Continue reading →

Keyword Research for SEO: The Definitive Guide (2020)

First, you’ll learn exactly what keyword research is (and why it’s important for SEO). I’ll also show you how keyword research helped grow my site’s search engine traffic to 170k+ unique visitors per month. Keyword research is the process of discovering words and phrases… Continue reading →

The State of SaaS Landing Pages in 2020

SaaS landing pages have changed a lot over the last 10 years. Long gone are the days of blocky designs, cold informational copywriting, and generic stock photos that show suspiciously-attractive people shaking hands in what looks like a very important business meeting. Continue reading →
